properties.comment: English language file for texjavahelpmk (in addition to texparserlib-en.xml) https://github.com/nlct/texjavahelp GPL-3.0 Nicola Talbot
properties.entry: I we you he she it they my our your his her its their mine ours yours his hers its theirs me us him her them a an the and but or nor as because since so there here where when which why how now such whoever however wherever in of with for by from at on to not no be am are is was were this that may should would ought must can use used using has have
{0} (or {1}) Print this help message and exit.

{0} <value> Debug verbosity. The value may be an integer or a comma-separated list of keywords: all Extremely verbose! io I/O operations popped Object popped from a stack decl Declarations sty-data Package data expansion Whenever an object is expanded expansion-list Whenever a list is expanded expansion-once Whenever an object is expanded once expansion-once-list Whenever a list is expanded once process Whenever an object is processed process-stack Whenever a stack is processed cs Control sequence process-generic-cs Whenever a GenericCommand is processed catcode Whenever a category code changes read Whenever a codepoint is read from a file
{0} (or {1}) <directory> Save output in <directory>, which must not already exist.
{0} <charset> Set the character encoding to <charset> for the output files.
{0} Use HTML entities for non-ASCII characters.
No aux data found! The document must be fully compiled first to ensure all auxiliary files are present.
No current node. The auxiliary files may be missing or not up-to-date.
No division data. The auxiliary files may be missing or not up-to-date.
Unexpected \ found in kpsewhich({0}). A command may not have been properly expanded.
Only one input file and output directory permitted
